Home News Weather Sports Entertainment Living Interact Jobs Autos Real Estate Rentals Classifieds Find n Save Home > Hunterdon County Democrat > Top news Sonic restaurant in Raritan Twp. will open soon UPDATE
Published: Friday, August 20, 2010, 1:44 PM Updated: Monday, August 23, 2010, 1:34 PM By Gabby Sanabria/Hunterdon County Democrat Hunterdon County Democrat Follow 9 Tweet Share close Digg Stumble Upon Fark Reddit Share Email Print Workers wash and clean today as they prepare the new Sonic restaurant in Raritan twp. for opening. (Photo by George Pacciello/staff photographer) RARITAN TWP.—The new retro-future-themed Sonic restaurant on Route 31 South may open as early as Tuesday morning, August 31. Those on Route 31 driving by Healthquest and the Stop&Shop market may have noticed the speedy construction of the Sonic Drive-in.
The national chain offers varied items such as burgers, chicken, salads and shakes. Sonic gives fast food a whole different twist, with servers rolling up to car windows delivering meals ordered via electronic menu boards, drive-thru. There is no seating inside, but there is a patio area with a menu board as well as a drive-thru for people who want to eat the food elsewhere.
Franchise co-owner Robert Mascia, who grew up in Somerset County, said today that he hopes to open it by Tuesday, August 31 at 9 a.m.; regular hours after opening week will be 6 a.m. to around midnight, he added.
The construction crew is finishing up and Mascia has been training the staff, partly at the Green Brook Sonic which he also co-owns.
There will be 60 employees at Sonic here, mostly part-timers. Mascia said about 15% of them will be servers and 90% of them are local residents.“We love the town and love the people,”he said adding that he is excited to be opening the restaurant but it’s been“hard work.”
All servers are tested for skating“proficiency,”Mascia noted. They have to be able to carry a tray, with drinks, while roller-skating and be able to stop.
They are given the option of using in-line or the old-style four wheel“quad”skates. Furthermore, they can use their own skates or get a pair from the restaurant.
Sonic eateries are open year-round. During any type of“inclement weather they go right to sneakers,”Mascia said, explaining that the servers must wear sneakers if the conditions are dangerous.
